NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Private automobiles are not allowed on campus.

NewWords.WordPhrase: begin to have (a particular quality or appearance) 呈现，具有
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. When some metals are combined in this way, the alloy takes on new physical properties.
e.g. The Hong Kong Bank is Hong Kong's largest financial institution.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 杜撰出来的人（或事）；神话
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Most societies have their own creation myths.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. that can move or be moved easily from place to place 流动的；可移动的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The mobile medical team will soon be here.

NewWords.WordPhrase: take advantage of 利用，从……中得到好处
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The company cashed in on its rival's difficulties by doubling its production.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. skilful in using one's hands to make things 手巧的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Having lived in China for almost two years, Paul is now very handy with his chopsticks.

NewWords.WordPhrase: be able to be summarized as 可归结为
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. What it comes down to is a choice between cutting wages or reducing the number of staff.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. of little importance 琐碎的，不重要的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I'm sorry to bother you with such a trivial problem.

NewWords.WordPhrase: order (sb.) around 将……差来差去；欺负
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I wish you would stop pushing little Jack around all the time.

NewWords.WordPhrase: become used to (living in a new home, doing a new job, etc.) 开始适应，习惯于
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We settled the children into new schools when we moved to London.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. the control and making of decisions in a business 管理
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The scientific management method has brought about many changes in factory production.
e.g. I still see my ex-wife once in a while.

NewWords.WordPhrase: cause (sb.) to undergo (a test, etc.); arrange for (sb.) to complete his education 使经受（考验）；使完成学业
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He put all his children through boarding-school（寄宿制学校）.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. frank and direct 直言不讳的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She is blunt about her personal life.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. an important topic for discussion or argument 问题，争论点
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. What issue are Linda and her husband arguing about now?

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. extremely good; excellent 极好的
on this occasion only, as an exception 就此一次，破例一次
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Just for once he arrived on time.
